module.name: types
module.descr: Starting with D6, types from Windows specific units that were needed in Kylix were extracted to this unit. So it mostly contains type of Windows origin that are needed in the VCL framework.

element.name: PLongint
element.descr: PLongint is defined in the system unit. This is an alias for Delphi/Kylix compatibility.

element.name: PSmallInt
element.descr: PSmallInt is defined in the system unit. This is an alias for Delphi/Kylix compatibility.

element.name: PDouble
element.descr: PDouble is defined in the system unit. This is an alias for Delphi/Kylix compatibility.

element.name: PByte
element.descr: PByte is defined in the system unit. This is an alias for Delphi/Kylix compatibility.

element.name: Largeint
element.descr: Largeint is an alias for the Int64 type defined in the system unit. This is an alias for Delphi/Kylix compatibility.

element.name: LARGE_INT
element.descr: LARGE_INT is an alias for the Int64 type defined in the system unit. This is an alias for Delphi/Kylix compatibility.

element.name: PLargeInt
element.descr: PLargeInt is an alias for the PInt64 type defined in the system unit. This is an alias for Delphi/Kylix compatibility.

element.name: LargeUint
element.descr: LargeUInt is an alias for the QWord type defined in the system unit. This is an alias for Delphi/Kylix compatibility.

element.name: LARGE_UINT
element.descr: LARGE_UINT is an alias for the QWord type defined in the system unit. This is an alias for Delphi/Kylix compatibility.

element.name: PLargeuInt
element.descr: PLargeUInt is an alias for the PQWord type defined in the system unit. This is an alias for Delphi/Kylix compatibility.

element.name: TIntegerDynArray
element.descr: TIntegerDynArray is a standard definition of a dynamical array of (32-bit, signed) integers.

element.name: TCardinalDynArray
element.descr: TCardinalDynArray is a standard definition of a dynamical array of (32-bit, unsigned) cardinals.

element.name: TWordDynArray
element.descr: TWordDynArray is a standard definition of a dynamical array of (16-bit, unsigned) words.

element.name: TSmallIntDynArray
element.descr: TSmallintDynArray is a standard definition of a dynamical array of (16-bit, unsigned) integers.

element.name: TByteDynArray
element.descr: TByteDynArray is a standard definition of a dynamical array of (8-bit, unsigned) bytes.

element.name: TShortIntDynArray
element.descr: TShortintDynArray is a standard definition of a dynamical array of (8-bit, signed) shortints.

element.name: TInt64DynArray
element.descr: TInt64DynArray is a standard definition of a dynamical array of (64-bit, signed) int64s.

element.name: TQWordDynArray
element.descr: TQWordDynArray is a standard definition of a dynamical array of (64-bit, unsigned) QWords.

element.name: TLongWordDynArray
element.descr: TLongWordDynArray is a standard definition of a dynamical array of (32-bit, unsigned) LongWords.

element.name: TSingleDynArray
element.descr: TSingleDynArray is a standard definition of a dynamical array of singles. (smallest floating point type)

element.name: TDoubleDynArray
element.descr: TSoubleDynArray is a standard definition of a dynamical array of doubles. (regular floating point type)

element.name: TBooleanDynArray
element.descr: TBooleanDynArray is a standard definition of a dynamical array of booleans.

element.name: TStringDynArray
element.descr: TStringDynArray is a standard definition of a dynamical array of Ansistrings.

element.name: TWideStringDynArray
element.descr: TWideStringDynArray is a standard definition of a dynamical array of WideStrings.

module.element:
Dynamic array of untyped pointers
TPointerDynArray is a standard definition of a dynamical array of untyped pointers.

descr.p: TPoint is a generic definition of a point in a 2-dimensional discrete plane, where X indicates the horizontal position, and Y the vertical position (positions usually measured in pixels), and 0,0 is the origin of the plane.
Usually, the origin is the upper-left corner of the screen, with Y increasing as one moves further down the screen - this is opposite to the mathematical view where Y increases as one moves upwards.
The coordinates are integers, (32-bit, signed) so the coordinate system runs from -MaxInt to MaxInt.

element.name: PPoint
element.descr: PPoint is a typed pointer to the type.

element.name: tagPOINT
element.descr: tagPOINT is a simple alias for

element.name: TRect
element.descr: TRect defines a rectangle in a discrete plane. It is described by the horizontal (left, right) or vertical (top, Bottom) positions (in pixels) of the edges, or, alternatively, by the coordinates of the top left (TopLeft) and bottom right (BottomRight) corners.

element.name: PRect
element.descr: PRect is a typed pointer to the type.

element.name: TSize
element.descr: TSize is a type to describe the size of a rectangular area, where cx is the width, cy is the height (in pixels) of the rectangle.

element.name: PSize
element.descr: PSize is a typed pointer to the type.

element.name: tagSIZE
element.descr: tagSize is an alias for the type.

element.name: TSmallPoint
element.descr: TSmallPoint defines a point in a 2-dimensional plane, just like , but the coordinates have a smaller range: The coordinates are smallints (16-bit, signed) and they run from -MaxSmallInt to maxSmallint.

element.name: PSmallPoint
element.descr: PSmallPoint is a typed pointer to the record.

element.name: TDuplicates
element.short: Enumeration type, indicating what to do with duplicates in a list.

descr.p: TDuplicates can be used to indicate how a list structure acts on the addition of a duplicate item to the list.

element.name: TDuplicates.dupIgnore
element.short: Ignore the new item, do not add it to the list.

element.name: TDuplicates.dupAccept
element.short: Accept duplicates, adding them to the list.

element.name: TDuplicates.dupError
element.short: Raise an error when an attempt is made to add a duplicate.

element.name: TOleChar
element.descr: TOleChar is an alias for the WideChar type, defined in the system unit.

element.name: POleStr
element.descr: POleStr is a pointer to a (double) null-terminated array of TOleChar characters.

element.name: PPOleStr
element.descr: PPOleStr is a typed pointer to a POleStr variable.

element.name: TListCallback
element.descr: TListCallback is the prototype for a Foreach operation on a list. It will be called with as Data the pointer in the list, and Arg will contain the extra user data added to the Foreach call. It can be used in methods of objects; for a version that can be used as a global procedure, see

element.name: TListStaticCallback
element.descr: TListStaticCallback is the prototype for a Foreach operation on a list. It will be called with as Data the pointer in the list, and Arg will contain the extra user data added to the Foreach call. It can be used in plain procedures; for a version that can be used as a method, see

element.name: GUID_NULL
element.descr: GUID_NULL is the definition of the NULL (empty) GUID.

element.name: PCLSID
element.descr: PCLSID is a pointer to a TCLSID type.

element.name: TCLSID
element.descr: TCLSID is an alias for the type.

element.name: PDWord
element.descr: PDWord is equivalent to the PCardinal type.

element.name: PDisplay
element.descr: PDisplay is defined for Delphi/Kylix compatibility and should not be used.

element.name: PEvent
element.descr: PEvent is defined for Delphi/Kylix compatibility and should not be used.

element.descr: TXrmOptionDescRec is defined for Delphi/Kylix compatibility and should not be used.

element.descr: XrmOptionDescRec is defined for Delphi/Kylix compatibility and should not be used.

element.name: PXrmOptionDescRec
element.descr: PXrmOptionDescRec is defined for Delphi/Kylix compatibility and should not be used.

element.name: Widget
element.descr: Widget is defined for Delphi/Kylix compatibility and should not be used.

element.name: WidgetClass
element.descr: WidgetClass is defined for Delphi/Kylix compatibility and should not be used.

element.name: ArgList
element.descr: ArgList is defined for Delphi/Kylix compatibility and should not be used.

element.name: Region
element.descr: Region is defined for Delphi/Kylix compatibility and should not be used.

element.name: _FILETIME
element.descr: _FILETIME describes a file time stamp. It is defined or Delphi/Kylix compatibility and should not be used except when implementing or accessing the IStream interface. The TDateTime type should be used instead.

element.name: _FILETIME.dwLowDateTime
element.short: Lower dword of the file date/time

element.name: _FILETIME.dwHighDateTime
element.short: High dword of the file date/time

element.name: tagSTATSTG
element.short: Storage statistics type for IStream interface.
element.descr: tagSTATSTG is used in the call. It describes a storage medium (typically a file).

element.name: tagSTATSTG.pwcsName
element.short: Name for the storage object. Typically the filename.

element.name: tagSTATSTG.grfLocksSupported
element.short: Locking operations supported by Storage type

element.name: tagSTATSTG.clsid
element.short: Class ID for the storage type

element.name: TStatStg
element.descr: TStatStg is a record type describing a storage medium. It is uses in the function.

element.name: IClassFactory
element.descr: IClassFactory is defined for Delphi/Kylix compatibility and should not be used.

element.name: IClassFactory.CreateInstance
element.short: Create a new instance of an interface.
element.descr: IClassFactory.CreateInstance is defined for Delphi/Kylix compatibility and should not be used.

element.name: IClassFactory.LockServer
element.descr: IClassFactory.LocksServer is defined for Delphi/Kylix compatibility and should not be used.

element.name: ISequentialStream
element.descr: ISequentialStream is the interface for streams which only support sequential reading of chunks of data. It is defined for Delphi/Kylix compatibility and should not be used.

element.name: ISequentialStream.Read
element.descr: Read reads cbCount bytes from the stream into the memory pointed to by pv and returns the number of bytes read in pcbread. The result is zero for success or an error code.

element.name: ISequentialStream.Write
element.descr: Write writes cbCount bytes from the memory pointed to by pv to the stream and returns the number of bytes written in pcbwritten. The result is zero for success or an error code.

element.name: IStream
element.descr: An abstract interface for an external (non pascal) stream, as defined in Microsoft COM interfaces

element.name: IStream.Seek
element.descr: Seek sets the stream position at dlibMove bytes from dwOrigin (one of the SEEK_* constants) and returns the new absolute position in libNewPosition. The function returns zero on success, or an error code.
element.errors: On error, a nonzero exit code is returned.

element.name: IStream.SetSize
element.descr: SetSize sets the size of the stream to libNewSize bytes, if the stream allows it. On success, zero is returned.
element.errors: On error, a nonzero exit code is returned.

element.name: IStream.CopyTo
element.short: Copy data from one stream to another
element.descr: CopyTo copies cb bytes from the stream to target stream stm. cbRead returns how many bytes were read from the stream, cbwrite returns how many bytes were actually written to the destination stream. The function returns zero on success.
element.errors: On error, a nonzero exit code is returned.

element.name: IStream.Commit
element.descr: Commit commits the data in the stream to the underlying medium. Flags is a set of options to control the commit operation (see MSDN for the possible flags).
element.errors: On error, a nonzero exit code is returned.

element.name: IStream.Revert
element.descr: Revert reverts all changes that were done to a transacted stream, i.e. all changes since the last commit. The function returns zero on success.
element.errors: On error, a nonzero exit code is returned.

element.name: IStream.LockRegion
element.short: Lock a region of bytes in the stream
element.descr: LockRegion locks a region of the storage, starting at libOffset, for cbCount bytes. The applied lock is of type dwLockType. The function returns zero if the lock was successfully applied.
element.errors: On error, a nonzero exit code is returned.

element.name: IStream.UnlockRegion
element.short: Unlocks a previously locked region of bytes in the stream
element.descr: UnlockRegion removes the lock on a region of the storage, starting at libOffset, for cbCount bytes. The lock must be of type dwLockType. The function returns zero if the lock was successfully removed.
element.errors: On error, a nonzero exit code is returned.

element.name: IStream.Stat
element.descr: Stat returns information about the stream in statstg, taking into account the flags in grfStatFlag (one of the STATFLAG_ constants). The function returns zero if the call was successful.
element.errors: On error, a nonzero exit code is returned.

element.name: IStream.Clone
element.descr: Clone returns an independent but initially equal copy of the stream in stm. The function returns zero if the call was successful.
element.errors: On error, a nonzero exit code is returned.

element.name: EqualRect
element.short: Check if two rectangles are equal.
element.descr: EqualRect returns True if the rectangles R1 and R2 are equal (i.e. have the position and size). If the rectangles differ, the function returns False

element.name: Rect
element.descr: Rect returns a rectangle structure with the 4 members Left, Top, Right and Bottom as passed in the arguments.

element.name: Bounds
element.short: Create a rectangle, given a position and size
element.descr: Bounds returns a TRect structure with the indicated position (Left=ALeft and Top=ATop) and size (Right=ALeft+AWidth and Bottom=ATop+AHeight)

element.name: Point
element.descr: Point returns a TPoint structure with the given position (X, Y).

element.name: PtInRect
element.short: Check whether a point is inside a rectangle.

descr.p: PtInRect returns True if p is located inside Rect, and False if it is located outside the rectangle.
descr.remark: Note that the bottom, right edges are not considered part of the rectangle, therefor a point located on one of these edges will not be considered part of the rectangle, meaning that for a record (10,10,100,100) the point (90,100) will not be considered part of the record, but 90,10 will be.

element.name: IntersectRect
element.descr: IntersectRect returns the intersection of the 2 rectangles R1 and R2 in Rect. It returns True if the 2 rectangles have an intersection, otherwise False is returned, and Rect is filled with zero.

element.name: UnionRect
element.descr: UnionRect retuns the rectangle that encompasses both R1 and R2 in Rect. It returns True if the resulting rectangle is not empty, False if the result is an empty rectangle (in which case the result is filled with zeroes)

element.name: IsRectEmpty
element.short: Check whether a rectangle is empty
element.descr: IsRectEmpty returns true if the rectangle is empty, i.e. has a zero or negative width or height.

element.name: OffsetRect
element.descr: OffsetRect offsets the rectangle Rect by a horizontal distance DX and a vertical distance DY. The operation returns True if the operation was successful, false if it was not (only possible if the address of Rect is Nil).

element.name: CenterPoint
element.short: Return the center point of a rectangle
element.descr: CenterPoint returns the center point of the rectangle Rect.

element.name: InflateRect
element.short: Increase the rectangle in size, keeping it centered
element.descr: InflateRect inflates the rectangle horizontally with dx pixels on each side, and vertically with dy pixels, thus keeping its center point on the same location. It returns true if the operation was successfully, False if it was not (only possible if the address of Rect is Nil).

element.name: Size
element.short: Return the size of the rectangle
element.descr: Size returns a TSize record with the indicated AWidth, AHeight. In the case ARect is passed, the width and height are calculated (taking into account that the right, bottom are not considered part of the rectangle).
